ai.summary: A short, easy 0.4 km walk on Carn Brea FP 20 in the UK. This gentle route offers a quick outdoor outing suitable for families and walkers of all ages, with minimal elevation and pleasant views from the Carn Brea area.
ai.terrain_summary: Primarily level to gently undulating paths with a mix of compact gravel, compacted soil, and short grassy sections. Generally easy underfoot, but can be muddy in wet weather and there may be uneven stones near edges or historic features.
ai.safety_notes: Stay on marked paths and be mindful of edges near any ruin or quarry features. Watch for uneven footing, loose stones, and wet surfaces. Weather can change quickly in the UK - bring a layer and sun protection. Supervise children and keep to a comfortable pace; carry a phone for emergencies.
ai.best_seasons: Year-round, with particularly pleasant conditions in spring and summer. Short enough to do during drier winter days if conditions permit.
